conflicts.description: llvm: A value for cuda_arch must be specified.
conflicts.name: cuda_arch=none

conflicts.description: llvm: Non-host backends needed for offloading, set targets=all
conflicts.name: targets=none

dependencies.description: GNU binutils, which contain the linker, assembler, objdump and others
dependencies.name: binutils

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.
dependencies.name: cmake

dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.
dependencies.name: cuda

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: cxx

dependencies.description:
libelf lets you read, modify or create ELF object files in an
architecture-independent way. The library takes care of size and endian
issues, e.g. you can process a file for SPARC processors on an Intel-
based system. Note: libelf is no longer maintained and packages that
depend on libelf should migrate to elfutils.
dependencies.name: elf

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The Hardware Locality (hwloc) software project. The Portable Hardware
Locality (hwloc) software package provides a portable abstraction
(across OS, versions, architectures, ...) of the hierarchical topology
of modern architectures, including NUMA memory nodes, sockets, shared
caches, cores and simultaneous multithreading. It also gathers various
system attributes such as cache and memory information as well as the
locality of I/O devices such as network interfaces, InfiniBand HCAs or
GPUs. It primarily aims at helping applications with gathering
information about modern computing hardware so as to exploit it
accordingly and efficiently.
dependencies.name: hwloc

dependencies.description: An autotools compatible port of the NetBSD editline library
dependencies.name: libedit

dependencies.description:
The libffi library provides a portable, high level programming interface
to various calling conventions. This allows a programmer to call any
function specified by a call interface description at run time.
dependencies.name: libffi

dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.
dependencies.name: libxml2

dependencies.description: The Lua programming language interpreter and library.
dependencies.name: lua

dependencies.description:
The ncurses (new curses) library is a free software emulation of curses
in System V Release 4.0, and more. It uses terminfo format, supports
pads and color and multiple highlights and forms characters and
function-key mapping, and has all the other SYSV-curses enhancements
over BSD curses.
dependencies.name: ncurses

dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.
dependencies.name: ninja

dependencies.description: Stringified perl data structures, suitable for both printing and eval
dependencies.name: perl-data-dumper

dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.
dependencies.name: pkgconfig

dependencies.description: Python 2 and 3 compatibility utilities.
dependencies.name: py-six

dependencies.description: The Python programming language.
dependencies.name: python

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependencies.description:
SWIG is an interface compiler that connects programs written in C and
C++ with scripting languages such as Perl, Python, Ruby, and Tcl. It
works by taking the declarations found in C/C++ header files and using
them to generate the wrapper code that scripting languages need to
access the underlying C/C++ code. In addition, SWIG provides a variety
of customization features that let you tailor the wrapping process to
suit your application.
dependencies.name: swig

dependencies.description:
XZ Utils is free general-purpose data compression software with high
compression ratio. XZ Utils were written for POSIX-like systems, but
also work on some not-so-POSIX systems. XZ Utils are the successor to
LZMA Utils.
dependencies.name: xz

dependencies.description:
Z3 is a theorem prover from Microsoft Research. It is licensed under the
MIT license.
dependencies.name: z3

dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.
dependencies.name: zlib-api

dependencies.description:
Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression
algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and
better compression ratios.
dependencies.name: zstd

dependent_to.description:
Apache TVM is an open source machine learning compiler framework for
CPUs, GPUs, and machine learning accelerators. It aims to enable machine
learning engineers to optimize and run computations efficiently on any
hardware backend.
dependent_to.name: apache-tvm

dependent_to.description: ARCHER, a data race detection tool for large OpenMP applications.
dependent_to.name: archer

dependent_to.description:
A cross-language development platform for in-memory data. This package
contains the C++ bindings.
dependent_to.name: arrow

dependent_to.description:
Axom provides a robust, flexible software infrastructure for the
development of multi-physics applications and computational tools.
dependent_to.name: axom

dependent_to.description:
barvinok is a library for counting the number of integer points in
parametric and non-parametric polytopes.
dependent_to.name: barvinok

dependent_to.description:
Binder is a tool for automatic generation of Python bindings for C++11
projects using Pybind11 and Clang LibTooling libraries. That is, Binder,
takes a C++ project and compiles it into objects and functions that are
all usable within Python. Binder is different from prior tools in that
it handles special features new in C++11.
dependent_to.name: binder

dependent_to.description: Compiler-based Application Analysis
dependent_to.name: byfl

dependent_to.description: C/C++ language server
dependent_to.name: ccls

dependent_to.description:
Chapel is a modern programming language that is parallel, productive,
portable, scalable and open-source. The Chapel package comes with many
options in the form of variants, most of which can be left unset to
allow Chapel's built-in scripts to determine the proper values based on
the environment.
dependent_to.name: chapel

dependent_to.description: a C++ header-only library for Nearest Neighbor (NN) search wih KD-trees.
dependent_to.name: cquery

dependent_to.description:
C-Reduce is a tool that takes a large C, C++, or OpenCL file that has a
property of interest (such as triggering a compiler bug) and
automatically produces a much smaller C/C++ file that has the same
property. It is intended for use by people who discover and report bugs
in compilers and other tools that process source code.
dependent_to.name: creduce

dependent_to.description:
C-Vise is a super-parallel Python port of the C-Reduce. The port is
fully compatible to the C-Reduce and uses the same efficient LLVM-based
C/C++ reduction tool named clang_delta.
dependent_to.name: cvise

dependent_to.description:
The Enzyme project is a tool for performing reverse-mode automatic
differentiation (AD) of statically-analyzable LLVM IR. This allows
developers to use Enzyme to automatically create gradients of their
source code without much additional work.
dependent_to.name: enzyme

dependent_to.description:
FPChecker (Floating-Point Checker) is a dynamic analysis tool to detect
floating-point errors in HPC applications.
dependent_to.name: fpchecker

dependent_to.description:
A meta-build system that generates build files for Ninja. This is a
fork of the Google GN package with some minor features and bug fixes
dependent_to.name: generate-ninja

dependent_to.description:
Halide is a programming language designed to make it easier to write
high-performance image and array processing code on modern machines.
dependent_to.name: halide

dependent_to.description: heyoka is a C++ library for integration of ODEs via Taylor’s method
dependent_to.name: heyoka

dependent_to.description:
hipSYCL is an implementation of the SYCL standard programming model over
NVIDIA CUDA/AMD HIP
dependent_to.name: hipsycl

dependent_to.description:
A lightweight JIT compiler for flexible data access in simulation
applications. impalajit@llvm is enhanced with LLVM JIT. This means that
impalajit@llvm is supposed to work on any architecture supported by
llvm, contrary to the impalajit@main package which is restricted to x86
architectures.This comes at the price of extra dependencies. Impala acts
as a backend for `easi` project.
dependent_to.name: impalajit

dependent_to.description:
Intel Implicit SPMD Program Compiler An open-source compiler for high-
performance SIMD programming on the CPU
dependent_to.name: ispc

dependent_to.description:
Include-what-you-use: A tool for use with clang to analyze #includes in
C and C++ source files.
dependent_to.name: iwyu

dependent_to.description: The Julia Language: A fresh approach to technical computing
dependent_to.name: julia

dependent_to.description:
The LDC project aims to provide a portable D programming language
compiler with modern optimization and code generation capabilities. LDC
is fully Open Source; the parts of the code not taken/adapted from other
projects are BSD-licensed (see the LICENSE file for details). Consult
the D wiki for further information: https://wiki.dlang.org/LDC
dependent_to.name: ldc

dependent_to.description:
The LDC project aims to provide a portable D programming language
compiler with modern optimization and code generation capabilities. LDC
is fully Open Source; the parts of the code not taken/adapted from other
projects are BSD-licensed (see the LICENSE file for details). Consult
the D wiki for further information: https://wiki.dlang.org/LDC This old
version of the compiler is needed to bootstrap newer ones.
dependent_to.name: ldc-bootstrap

dependent_to.description: Modern interactive LLVM-based Fortran compiler
dependent_to.name: lfortran

dependent_to.description: A generic abstraction for the compression of dense tensors
dependent_to.name: libpressio

dependent_to.description:
The OpenMP subproject provides an OpenMP runtime for use with the OpenMP
implementation in Clang. This branch includes experimental changes for
OMPT, the OpenMP Tools interface
dependent_to.name: llvm-openmp-ompt

dependent_to.description:
MUST detects usage errors of the Message Passing Interface (MPI) and
reports them to the user. As MPI calls are complex and usage errors
common, this functionality is extremely helpful for application
developers that want to develop correct MPI applications. This includes
errors that already manifest: segmentation faults or incorrect results
as well as many errors that are not visible to the application developer
or do not manifest on a certain system or MPI implementation.
dependent_to.name: must

dependent_to.description: An OpenCL device simulator and debugger.
dependent_to.name: oclgrind

dependent_to.description:
OClint: a static analysis tool for C, C++, and Objective-C code OCLint
is a static code analysis tool for improving quality and reducing
defects by inspecting C, C++ and Objective-C code and looking for
potential problems
dependent_to.name: oclint

dependent_to.description:
GNU Octave is a high-level language, primarily intended for numerical
computations. It provides a convenient command line interface for
solving linear and nonlinear problems numerically, and for performing
other numerical experiments using a language that is mostly compatible
with Matlab. It may also be used as a batch-oriented language.
dependent_to.name: octave

dependent_to.description: Open3D: A Modern Library for 3D Data Processing.
dependent_to.name: open3d

dependent_to.description:
OpenSTA is a gate level static timing verifier. As a stand-alone
executable it can be used to verify the timing of a design using
standard file formats. * Verilog netlist * Liberty library * SDC timing
constraints * SDF delay annotation * SPEF parasitics
dependent_to.name: opensta

dependent_to.description: OpenVDB - a sparse volume data format.
dependent_to.name: openvdb

dependent_to.description:
Portable Computing Language (pocl) is an open source implementation of
the OpenCL standard which can be easily adapted for new targets and
devices, both for homogeneous CPU and heterogeneous GPUs/accelerators.
dependent_to.name: pocl

dependent_to.description: Low level implementations for computer vision in Rust.
dependent_to.name: py-kornia-rs

dependent_to.description:
The repository contains code that taken from the LLVM project, to make
it easier to install clang's python bindings.
dependent_to.name: py-libclang

dependent_to.description: A lightweight LLVM python binding for writing JIT compilers
dependent_to.name: py-llvmlite

dependent_to.description: Python bindings for Qt.
dependent_to.name: py-pyside2

dependent_to.description: Qt is a comprehensive cross-platform C++ application framework.
dependent_to.name: qt

dependent_to.description: Qt Tools contains tools like Qt Designer.
dependent_to.name: qt-tools

dependent_to.description: RTags is a client/server application that indexes C/C++ code
dependent_to.name: rtags

dependent_to.description:
SALT: A next generation LLVM-based Source Analysis Toolkit for
performance instrumentation of HPC applications
dependent_to.name: salt

dependent_to.description:
The Score-P measurement infrastructure is a highly scalable and easy-to-
use tool suite for profiling, event tracing, and online analysis of HPC
applications.
dependent_to.name: scorep

dependent_to.description:
The Structural Simulation Toolkit Macroscale Element Library simulates
large-scale parallel computer architectures for the coarse-grained study
of distributed-memory applications. The simulator is driven from either
a trace file or skeleton application. SST/macro's modular architecture
can be extended with additional network models, trace file formats,
software services, and processor models.
dependent_to.name: sst-macro

dependent_to.description: SymEngine is a fast symbolic manipulation library, written in C++.
dependent_to.name: symengine

dependent_to.description:
Yosys is a framework for RTL synthesis tools. It currently has extensive
Verilog-2005 support and provides a basic set of synthesis algorithms
for various application domains. Yosys can be adapted to perform any
synthesis job by combining the existing passes (algorithms) using
synthesis scripts and adding additional passes as needed by extending
the yosys C++ code base. Yosys is free software licensed under the ISC
license (a GPL compatible license that is similar in terms to the MIT
license or the 2-clause BSD license).
dependent_to.name: yosys

dependent_to.description:
A general-purpose programming language and toolchain for maintaining
robust, optimal, and reusable software.
dependent_to.name: zig

description:
The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and
toolchain technologies. Despite its name, LLVM has little to do with
traditional virtual machines, though it does provide helpful libraries
that can be used to build them. The name "LLVM" itself is not an
acronym; it is the full name of the project.
name: llvm

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system

variants.description: CMake build type
variants.name: build_type

variants.description: Build the LLVM C/C++/Objective-C compiler frontend
variants.name: clang

variants.description: Enable code-signing on macOS
variants.name: code_signing

variants.description: Build the LLVM compiler runtime, including sanitizers, either as a runtime (with just-build Clang) or as a project (with the compiler in use)
variants.name: compiler-rt

variants.description: Build with CUDA
variants.name: cuda

variants.description: CUDA architecture
variants.name: cuda_arch

variants.description: Build the LLVM Fortran compiler frontend (experimental - parser only, needs GCC)
variants.name: flang

variants.description: the build system generator to use
variants.name: generator

variants.description: Add support for LTO with the gold linker plugin
variants.name: gold

variants.description: CMake interprocedural optimization
variants.name: ipo

variants.description: Build the LLVM C++ standard library either as a runtime (with just-build Clang) or as a project (with the compiler in use)
variants.name: libcxx

variants.description: Build with OpenMP capable thread sanitizer
variants.name: libomp_tsan

variants.description: Build the OpenMP offloading library
variants.name: libomptarget

variants.description: Allow debug output with the environment variable LIBOMPTARGET_DEBUG=1
variants.name: libomptarget_debug

variants.description: Build the LLVM unwinder libraryeither as a runtime (with just-build Clang) or as a project (with the compiler in use)
variants.name: libunwind

variants.description: Link LLVM tools against the LLVM shared library
variants.name: link_llvm_dylib

variants.description: Build the LLVM linker
variants.name: lld

variants.description: Build the LLVM debugger
variants.name: lldb

variants.description: Build a combined LLVM shared library with all components
variants.name: llvm_dylib

variants.description: Enable lua scripting inside lldb
variants.name: lua

variants.description: Build with MLIR support
variants.name: mlir

variants.description: Build the Offload subproject
variants.name: offload

variants.description: Build OpenMP either as a runtime (with just-build Clang) or as a project (with the compiler in use)
variants.name: openmp

variants.description: Build the LLVM polyhedral optimization plugin, only builds for 3.7.0+
variants.name: polly

variants.description: Install python bindings
variants.name: python

variants.description: Add shared library symbol version
variants.name: shlib_symbol_version

variants.description: Build with split dwarf information
variants.name: split_dwarf

variants.description: What targets to build. Spack's target family is always added (e.g. X86 is automatically enabled when targeting znver2).
variants.name: targets

variants.description: Add a symbol suffix
variants.name: version_suffix

variants.description: Use Z3 for the clang static analyzer
variants.name: z3

variants.description: Enable zstd support for static analyzer / lld
variants.name: zstd
